snippet.title: Invinco - (1979) - Arcade - gameplay
snippet.description:
Sega © 1979
[Coin-Op] Arcade Video Game
Emulator: MAME 0.194

Sega is showing they have some arcade chops this year.  This is a Space Invaders type of game with a few new elements.  First the top row of baddies takes 3 hits to actually destroy.  They also start alternating rows some going left some right, and either side hits the edge of the screen they drop down a level.  So that makes it more challenging.  Good sound effects, but doesn't quite get the background music right... only alternates two notes instead of the nicely descending 4 note tension that Space Invaders gives us.  

The other nice addition is at the end of each level we sort of get a mini boss battle against motherships for extra bonus points.  They are random in their movements and drop down towards you while laying out a bunch of enemy fire.  I only made it past level 3 which dropped 3 simultaneous alien ships on me... don't know what further levels might bring.  I wasn't excited to play another Space Invaders, but this one was pretty good.
